item.title: Charity add a quote by Carl Sagan
item.description: "A book is made from a tree. It is an assemblage of flat, flexible parts (still called "leaves") imprinted with dark pigmented squiggles. One glance at it and you hear the voice of another person, perhaps someone dead for thousands of years. Across the millennia, the author is speaking, clearly and silently, inside your head, directly to you. Writing is perhaps the greatest of human inventions, binding together people, citizens of distant epochs, who never knew one another. Books break the shackles of time ― proof that humans can work magic." -- Carl Sagan

item.title: Charity add a quote by Charles de Lint
item.description: "It's easy to believe in magic when you're young. Anything you couldn't explain was magic then. It didn't matter if it was science or a fairy tale. Electricity and elves were both infinitely mysterious and equally possible - elves probably more so." -- Charles de Lint

item.title: Charity add a quote by Richard Bach
item.description: "A professional writer is an amateur who didn't quit." -- Richard Bach

item.title: Charity add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "I have always imagined that Paradise will be a kind of library." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Charity add a quote by Charity Bradford
item.description: "Magic is in your blood and you'll find yourself again soon enough. --Landry Sutton" -- Charity Bradford

item.title: Charity add a quote by Charity Bradford
item.description: "You will learn to be wise, or you will destroy yourselves as effectively as the Dragumon wished." --Jewel" -- Charity Bradford

item.title: Charity add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description: "Success is liking yourself, liking what you do, and liking how you do it." -- Maya Angelou

item.title: Charity add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "I will prepare and some day my chance will come." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Charity add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "By failing to prepare, you are preparing to fail." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Charity add a quote by Stephen Richards
item.description: "You are essentially who you create yourself to be and all that occurs in your life is the result of your own making." -- Stephen Richards

item.title: Charity add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "you can, you should, and if you’re brave enough to start, you will." -- Stephen King

item.title: Charity add a quote by Franz Kafka
item.description:
"A non-writing writer is a monster courting insanity."
[<i>Letter to Max Brod</i>, July 5, 1922]" -- Franz Kafka
